dxf2svg.svg
Class SvgArc

java.lang.Object
  dxf2svg.svg.SvgElement
      dxf2svg.svg.SvgObject
          dxf2svg.svg.SvgGraphicElement
              dxf2svg.svg.SvgDoubleEndedGraphicElement
                  dxf2svg.svg.SvgArc
All Implemented Interfaces:
java.lang.Cloneable
public final class SvgArc
extends SvgDoubleEndedGraphicElement

This class encapsulates the SVG arc element. This class will compensate for the SVG Plug-in version 3.01 and 3.02 bug where by arcs that have 0.0 values for rx and or ry will crash the browser.

Version:
1.62 - September 15, 2005
Author:
Andrew Nisbet
See Also:
getElementAsPath(boolean), calculateMyUniqueData()

setCounterClockwiseFlag

public void setCounterClockwiseFlag(int isCounterClockwise)
Sets the CounterClockwize flag. Normal angle orientation dictates that 90 degrees is north and 270 degrees is south. The CounterClockwize flag means that 90 degrees is in the south and 270 is in the north.

0 = counterclockwize (90 at south). 1 = normal, default, counterclockwise (90 at north).

getEndPoint

public Point getEndPoint()
This method calculates and returns the end point of the arc. This is primarily required for animation when we compare objects' points to one-another to see if they are located at the same position and therefore animated as a group.

Overrides:
getEndPoint in class SvgDoubleEndedGraphicElement

getStartPoint

public Point getStartPoint()
This method returns the start point of an arc. Make no mistake, the start point is not the Anchor, but rather a calculation based on the location of an Anchor.

Overrides:
getStartPoint in class SvgDoubleEndedGraphicElement
Returns:
Point The anchor point or point of origin for the object.
